page.title: 16DODFORD CHURCH, BROMSGROVE
page.content: {Holy Trinity and St. Mary's Church, {Dodford}was built in 1907-08. The first vicar paid to have it built. Before that, everyone had to go to church in Bromsgrove. The church is built with large blocks of grey stone and cement covered in pebbles. It has plain glass arched windows except for one 30-paned round window. At the base of the square tower is a metal door, leading up a spiral staircase to the battlements at the top. There are two bells in the tower. Around the church is a small grave- yard with wild flowers. There is one grave dated 1900, before the church was built. The children from{Dodford {First School}often walk to the church, to work, or to attend a service. The graveyard contains the graves of some of the children's grandparents and great-grandparents.
